methods.name: attrib
methods.comment:
Add attribute declaration for this buffer. Once the attributes declared, the buffer can be linked to
the program's attributes using [attribPointer](#item-38).

params.name: name
params.comment: The name of the program's attribute

params.name: size
params.comment: The size of the attribute (`1` for a number, `2` for a vec2, etc.)

params.name: type
params.comment: The type of data (`GL_FLOAT`, `GL_SHORT`, etc.)

params.name: normalize
params.comment: Indicate if the data must be normalized

methods.name: attribPointer
methods.comment:
Link the given program attributes to this buffer. You should first declare attributes using [attrib](#item-25)
before calling this method.

params.name: program
params.comment: The program to link

classes.name: Fbo
classes.comment: This class manages framebuffers and their attachments.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context this FBO belongs to

properties.comment: The list of the bindingPoint/attachment pairs setup for this FBO

properties.comment: The list of the attachments setup for this FBO

properties.comment: The underlying webgl framebuffer

properties.comment: The webgl context this FBO belongs to

properties.name: height
properties.comment: The height of this FBO

properties.name: width
properties.comment: The width of this FBO

methods.comment: Resize all attachments to the FBO size.

methods.name: attach
methods.comment:
Add an attachment to this FBO.
The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

params.name: bindingPoint
params.comment: The binding point of the attachment (`GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0`, `GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT`, etc.)

params.name: res
params.comment: The texture or buffer to attach

methods.name: attachColor
methods.comment:
Attach a texture to the color attachment 0 of this FBO.
The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

params.name: format
params.comment: The pixel format of the texture (`GL_RGB`, `GL_RGBA`, etc.), defaults to `GL_RGB`

params.name: type
params.comment: The pixel data type of the texture (`GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE`, `GL_FLOAT`, etc.), defaults to `GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE`

params.name: internal
params.comment: The pixel internal format of the texture, defaults to the `format` parameter value

methods.name: attachDepth
methods.comment:
Attach a renderbuffer/texture to the depth/stencil attachment of this FBO.
 The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

params.name: depth
params.comment: Add depth component or not

params.name: stencil
params.comment: Add stencil component or not

params.name: useTexture
params.comment: Use a Texture2D instead of a RenderBuffer. If true, the depth param must also be true. You also must ensure Depth Texture capability is available on your context.

methods.name: bind
methods.comment: Bind the underlying webgl framebuffer.

methods.name: clear
methods.comment: Clear all buffers (color, depth and stencil).

methods.name: defaultViewport
methods.comment: Set the webgl viewport to the size of this FBO.

methods.name: detach
methods.comment:
Remove an attachment from this FBO.
The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

params.name: bindingPoint
params.comment: The binding point of the attachment (`GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0`, `GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT`, etc.)

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Delete all webgl objects related to this FBO.

methods.name: getAttachment

methods.name: getColor

params.name: index

methods.name: getColorTexture
methods.comment: Get the color texture of this FBO (if it exists).

params.name: index
params.comment: The color attachment index

methods.name: getDepth
methods.comment: Get the depth attachment of this FBO (if it exists).

methods.name: isValid
methods.comment:
Check if the FBO is valid.
The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

methods.comment: Resize the FBO and its attachments.

classes.name: Program
classes.comment:
This class provides provides shader compilation and webgl program linking functionality.
It also give you convenient access to active uniforms and attributes.

constructors.name: Program
constructors.comment: You can pass optional shader code to immediatly compile shaders or compile them later with [compile](#item-286).

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context this Program belongs to

params.name: vert
params.comment: The vertex shader code

params.name: frag
params.comment: The fragment shader code

params.name: defs
params.comment: A string to prepend to both fragment and vertex shader code

properties.name: _cuid
properties.comment: Unique id for the program that updates every time it is compiled

properties.name: _uid
properties.comment: Unique id for the program

properties.name: dyns
properties.comment: The list of uniform & attribute names

properties.name: fShader
properties.comment: The underlying webgl fragment shader

properties.name: gl
properties.comment: The webgl context this Program belongs to

properties.name: program
properties.comment: The underlying webgl program

properties.name: ready
properties.comment: Whether the program is ready to use or not

properties.name: vShader
properties.comment: The underlying webgl vertex shader

properties.name: debug
properties.comment: Can be set to true to check and log compilation and linking errors

methods.name: _grabParameters
methods.comment: List all uniforms and attributes and create a helper function for each on Program instance.
methods.example:
For a uniform
```glsl
uniform vec3 uDirection;
```
it creates a method
```js
program.uDirection(1, 0, 0);
```

methods.name: bind
methods.comment: Alias for [use](#item-282).

methods.name: compile
methods.comment:
Compile vertex and fragment shader, then link webgl program.
This method can be safely called several times.

params.name: vert
params.comment: The vertex shader code

params.name: frag
params.comment: The fragment shader code

params.name: prefix
params.comment: A string to prepend to both fragment and vertex shader code

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Delete all webgl objects related to this Program.

methods.name: use
methods.comment:
Bind the underlying webgl program.
Shortcut for `gl.useProgram()`.

functions.name: getTextureFiltering
functions.comment:
Compute texture filtering enum from parameters.
Will return one of the following :
- `NEAREST`
- `LINEAR`
- `NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST`
- `LINEAR_MIPMAP_NEAREST`
- `NEAREST_MIPMAP_LINEAR`
- `LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR`

classes.name: Camera
classes.comment:
This class provides functionalities for cameras.
You can choose which type of projection to use with the lens.

params.name: lens
params.comment: The lens to use for this camera

typeParams.name: TLens
typeParams.comment: The type of lens this camera uses

properties.name: _view
properties.comment: The view matrix for this camera

properties.name: _viewProj
properties.comment: The view projection matrix for this camera

properties.name: lens
properties.comment: The lens this camera uses

methods.name: _computeWorldMatrix
methods.comment: Compute camera world matrix and update camera view matrix.

params.name: skipParents
params.comment: If true, the camera's parent's world matrix will not be computed

methods.name: getMVP
methods.comment:
Compute a model view projection matrix from a transform matrix using the camera view projection matrix, and return the result.

You can use this to convert a matrix from world space to clip space.

**Note :** This method returns a local matrix variable, so you should not store it for later use.

params.name: model
params.comment: The transform matrix to use

methods.name: modelViewMatrix
methods.comment:
Compute a model view matrix from a transform matrix using the camera view matrix.

You can use this to convert a matrix from world space to camera space.

params.name: out
params.comment: The matrix to write to

params.name: model
params.comment: The transform matrix to use

methods.name: modelViewProjectionMatrix
methods.comment:
Compute a model view projection matrix from a transform matrix using the camera view projection matrix.

You can use this to convert a matrix from world space to clip space.

params.name: out
params.comment: The matrix to write to

params.name: model
params.comment: The transform matrix to use

methods.name: unproject
methods.comment:
Reverse project a point using the camera view projection matrix.

You can use this to transform a point from screen space to world space.

params.name: out
params.comment: The matrix to write to

params.name: v
params.comment: The point's coordinates

methods.name: updateViewProjectionMatrix
methods.comment: Update camera view projection matrix.

params.name: w
params.comment: The width of the canvas

params.name: h

classes.name: ConfigStack
classes.comment: This class manages the GLConfig stack.

properties.name: _headPos
properties.comment: The position in the stack of the last "commit"

properties.name: _ptr
properties.comment: The current position in the stack

properties.name: _sets
properties.comment: The list of the bitmask set of all the configs in the stack

properties.name: _size
properties.comment: The allocated size of the stack

properties.name: _stack
properties.comment:
The values of the configs at each position in the stack.
The stack is a 2d array where each row is a config.

properties.name: _wcfg
properties.comment: The position in the stack of the last "commit"

methods.name: _grow
methods.comment: Grow the allocated size of stack.

methods.name: commit
methods.comment: Copy the current stack state to the given patch config and mark HEAD as the current position.

params.name: patch
params.comment: The config to copy to

methods.name: copyConfig
methods.comment:
Copy a row in the stack to the given config.

This will copy the row from `_stack` to the config `_dat`
and the row from `_set` to the config `_set`.

params.name: at
params.comment: The position in the stack to copy from

params.name: cfg
params.comment: The config to copy to

methods.name: flush
methods.comment: Remove all configs from the stack.

methods.name: initFromGL
methods.comment:
Setup initial config from to match the config the
given webgl context is currently in, and set the
first config of the stack to this config.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context to match

methods.name: pop
methods.comment:
Remove the last config from the stack.

If the HEAD position is ahead of the current position in the stack,
the current position config set is unioned with the removed config set.

methods.name: push
methods.comment:
Add a config to the stack.

The input config is applied to the previous config in the stack,
and the resulting config is added to the stack.
methods.example:
If the previous config in the stack is:

```js
[A, B, C, D, E, F, G] // previous row in _stack
[1, 0, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0] // previous row in _sets
```

And the input config is :

```js
[?, ?, X, D, E, ?, ?] // cfg _dat
[0, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0, 0] // cfg _set
```

Then the new config in the stack is:

```js
[A, B, X, D, E, F, G] // new row in _stack
[1, 0, 1, 1, 1, 1, 0] // new row in _sets
```

params.name: cfg
params.comment: The config to add to the stack

classes.name: GLConfig
classes.comment: This class manages configs for the webgl context.

properties.name: _dat
properties.comment: The values of the config. Each value is stored in a specific slot of the array.

properties.name: _set
properties.comment: The bitmask set of the config. It indicates which values are set.

methods.name: blendColor
methods.comment:
Set blending color for this config.

The params values should be floats between `0` and `1`.

params.name: r
params.comment: The value for the red component

params.name: g
params.comment: The value for the green component

params.name: b
params.comment: The value for the blue component

params.name: a
params.comment: The value for the alpha component

methods.name: blendEquation
methods.comment:

The possible params values are :
- `GL_FUNC_ADD`

params.name: alphaEq

- `GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR`
- `GL_SRC_ALPHA`
- `GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA`

- `GL_DST_COLOR`

- `GL_SRC_ALPHA_SATURATE`

params.name: dst
params.comment: The multiplier for the destination blending factors

- `GL_SRC_COLOR`
- `GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR`
- `GL_SRC_ALPHA`

Apply this config to the input config.

It creates a new config that represents the difference

- `GL_KEEP`

- `GL_REPLACE`
- `GL_INCR`
- `GL_INCR_WRAP`

- `GL_INVERT`

params.name: sfail
params.comment: The function to use when the front stencil test fails

params.name: dpfail
params.comment: The function to use when the front stencil test passes, but the depth test fails

params.name: dppass
params.comment: The function to use when both the front stencil test and the depth test pass

params.name: sfailback
params.comment: The function to use when the back stencil test fails

params.name: dpfailback
params.comment: The function to use when the back stencil test passes, but the depth test fails

params.name: dppassback
params.comment: The function to use when both the back stencil test and the depth test pass

methods.name: toDefault
methods.comment: Set this config to the default config.

methods.name: viewport
methods.comment: Set the viewport for this config.

params.name: x
params.comment: The x coordinate of the lower left corner of the viewport origin

params.name: y
params.comment: The y coordinate of the lower left corner of the viewport origin

params.name: w
params.comment: The width of the viewport

params.name: h
params.comment: The height of the viewport

methods.name: decodeHalf
methods.comment: Decode Uint16 to float32

methods.name: encodeHalf
methods.comment: Encode float32 to Uint16

classes.name: GLState
classes.comment:
This class manages the webgl state.

It is used to manage a stack of GLConfigs and apply the current state to the webgl context.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context this GLState belongs to

properties.name: _state
properties.comment: The current config

properties.name: _validCfg
properties.comment: Whether the config stack has been changed or not

properties.name: cfgStack
properties.comment: The config stack managing all GLConfigs

properties.name: gl
properties.comment: The webgl context this GLState belongs to

properties.name: _instances
properties.comment: The list of every GLState instance created, indexed by the corresponding webgl context

methods.name: apply
methods.comment: Apply the current stack state to the webgl context.

methods.name: config
methods.comment: Create a LocalConfig from this GLState.

methods.name: now
methods.comment:
Apply a config to the webgl context immediatly,
without keeping it in the stack.

params.name: cfg
params.comment: The config to apply

methods.name: pop
methods.comment: Remove the last config from the stack.

methods.name: push
methods.comment: Push a config to the stack.

params.name: cfg
params.comment: The config to push

methods.name: get
methods.comment: Create a GLState instance or return the existing one for given webgl context.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context

classes.name: LocalConfig
classes.comment:
This class manages local configs.

It can be used for configs that will be applied directly,
and not pushed to the stack.

params.name: state
params.comment: The GLState for the webgl context this config belongs to

properties.name: state
properties.comment: The GLState for the webgl context this config belongs to

methods.name: apply
methods.comment: Apply this config to the webgl context immediatly.

enumerations.name: SetsBits
enumerations.comment: The bitmask for each config set.

enumerations.name: Slots
enumerations.comment: The slot number for each config data.

classes.name: Sync
classes.comment:
This class can be used as a wrapper around a WebGLSync object, and provides a promise based completion.

It is used to synchronize activities between the GPU and the application, and is only available for WebGL2. As a fallback, the Sync will be immediately signaled if the WebGLSync object isn't available.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context this Sync belongs to

properties.name: _defer
properties.comment: The object providing the promise's resolve & reject functions

properties.name: _invalidated
properties.comment: Whether the Sync is invalidated or not. The Sync is invalidated on release.

properties.name: _pooled
properties.comment: Whether the Sync is pooled or not.

properties.name: _sync
properties.comment: The implementation of the WebGLSync object

properties.name: gl
properties.comment: The webgl context this Sync belongs to

properties.name: promise
properties.comment: The underlying promise

methods.name: auto
methods.comment: Start the pool auto resolve loop.

methods.name: resolve
methods.comment: Call [_complete](#item-50) for every signaled Sync in the pool.

methods.name: stop
methods.comment: Stop the pool auto resolve loop.

methods.name: _complete
methods.comment: Resolve the promise and release everything related to this Sync.

methods.name: _pool
methods.comment: Pool this Sync.

methods.name: _release
methods.comment:
Release everything related to this Sync.

Used by [dispose](#item-31) and [_complete](#item-50).

methods.name: _unpool
methods.comment: Remove this Sync from the pool.

methods.name: clientWaitSync
methods.comment:
Shortcut to `gl.clientWaitSync`.

**Important :** The [insert](#item-29) method must have been called before calling this method.

params.name: timeout
params.comment: The time to wait for the sync object to become signaled (in nanosec), defaults to 100ms

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Dispose of everything related related to this Sync.

methods.name: insert
methods.comment:
Create a WebGLSync object and insert it in the GL command stream. Then pool this Sync.

The promise will be resolved when the Sync is signaled.

methods.name: isSignaled
methods.comment: Know whether the `GL_SYNC_STATUS` is `GL_SIGNALED` or not.

methods.name: then
methods.comment: Shortcut to `this.promise.then`.

params.name: onFulfilled
params.comment: The callback to be called when the promise is fulfilled

params.name: onRejected
params.comment: The callback to be called when the promise is rejected

interfaces.name: ISyncImplementation
interfaces.comment: The implementation of a WebGLSync object.

methods.name: clientWaitSync
methods.comment: Shortcut to `gl.clientWaitSync`.

params.name: timeout
params.comment: The time to wait for the sync object to become signaled (in nanosec)

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Dispose of everything related to this SyncImplementation.

methods.name: isSignaled
methods.comment: Know whether the `GL_SYNC_STATUS` is `GL_SIGNALED` or not.

classes.name: Vao
classes.comment:
This class manages VAOs (Vertex Array Objects).

It is used to manage attribute pointers setup for given program and buffers, and provides a transparent fallback if VAO extension isn't available.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context this VAO belongs to

properties.name: _impl
properties.comment: The implementation of the VAO

properties.name: gl
properties.comment: The webgl context this VAO belongs to

methods.name: bind
methods.comment:
Bind the VAO.
You need to call this method *before* each draw call.

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Delete all webgl objects related to this VAO.

methods.name: setup
methods.comment: Initialize attrib pointer setup for given program and buffers.

params.name: prg
params.comment: The program to use

params.name: buffers
params.comment: The list of buffers containing the vertex data

params.name: indices
params.comment: The buffer containing the index data

methods.name: unbind
methods.comment:
Unbind the VAO.
You need to call this method *after* each draw call.

interfaces.name: IVaoImplementation
interfaces.comment: The implementation of a webgl VAO.

methods.name: bind
methods.comment: Bind the VAO.

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Delete all webgl objects related to this VAO.

methods.name: setup
methods.comment: Initialize attrib pointer setup for given program and buffers.

params.name: prg
params.comment: The program to use

params.name: buffers
params.comment: The list of buffers containing the vertex data

params.name: indices
params.comment: The buffer containing the index data

methods.name: unbind
methods.comment: Unbind the VAO.
